test-case.name: fn-subsequence-mix-args-024
test-case.description: subsequence(X, -INF, +INF Returns () because -INF + INF = NaN, and position() lt NaN is false. See XSLT test case bug 837 (member only bugzilla)

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-1
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence()`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-2
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence(1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-3
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence(1, 1, 1, 1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-4
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(subsequence((), 2, 3))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-5
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(subsequence((1, 2, 3), 2, -10))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-6
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), 4)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-7
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), 4, 1)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-8
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3.1, "four"), 4)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-9
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3.1, "four"), 4, 1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-10
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3.1, "four"), 3, 1) instance of xs:decimal`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-11
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3.1, "four"), 1, 1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-12
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), 4, -3))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-13
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), -4, -3))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-14
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3), 1, 1) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-15
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3), 1, 1) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-16
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3), 3) eq 3`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-17
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3), 1, 1)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-18
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3), 1, 3)) eq 3`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-19
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), 4)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-20
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence(1 to 3, 1, 1)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-21
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(subsequence((1, 2), 4))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-22
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((5, 6, 7, 8), 2, 1) eq 6`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-23
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2), 2)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-24
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), 2)) eq 3`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-25
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 3, "four"), 2, 2)) eq 2`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-26
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence((1, 2, 3.1, "four"), 1, 1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-27
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `1 eq "a string"`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-28
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `1 eq subsequence(("1", 2, 3.1, "four"), 1, 1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-29
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence(("1", 2, 3.1, "four"), 1, 1) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-30
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `subsequence(error(), 1, 1)`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-31
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((1, 2, 2, current-time()), 2, 2)) eq 2`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-32
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence(remove(current-time(), 1), 1, 1)) eq 0`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-33
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `deep-equal(1, subsequence((1, 2, current-time()), 1, 1))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-34
test-case.description: Using subsequence inside a predicate.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-35
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `empty(subsequence((current-time(), 1), 4))`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-36
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((current-time(), 1), 4)) eq 0`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-37
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((current-time(), 2 , 3), 1)) eq 3`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-38
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((current-time(), 2 , 3), 3)) eq 1`.

test-case.name: K-SeqSubsequenceFunc-39
test-case.description: A test whose essence is: `count(subsequence((current-time(), 2 , 3, 4), 2, 2)) eq 2`.

test-case.description: Apply a predicate to the result of fn:subsequence().

test-case.description: Apply a predicate to the result of fn:subsequence().

test-case.description: Apply a predicate to the result of fn:subsequence().

test-case.description: Apply a predicate to the result of fn:subsequence().

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-1
test-case.description: Use fn:subsequence where the input is via variable references.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-2
test-case.description: A zero length.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-3
test-case.description: A negative length.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-4
test-case.description: Ensure rounding is done properly, 1.1.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-5
test-case.description: Ensure rounding is done properly, 1.8.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-6
test-case.description: Ensure rounding is done properly, 1.4.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-7
test-case.description: Ensure rounding is done properly, 1.5.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-8
test-case.description: Have subsequence inside a function body, to trap bugs related to inference, rewrites and function call sites. This expression typically constant propagates to a sequence of integers.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-9
test-case.description: Have subsequence inside a function body, to trap bugs related to inference, rewrites and function call sites(#2). This expression typically constant propagates to a sequence of integers.

test-case.name: K2-SeqSubsequenceFunc-10
test-case.description: Have a call to subsequence that triggers a type error in an expression which can be const folded(derived from functionbc20_037).

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-001
test-case.description: Test fn:subsequence on -INF and INF

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-002
test-case.description: Test fn:subsequence with length NaN

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-003
test-case.description: Test fn:subsequence with starting position NaN

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-004
test-case.description: Test unbounded fn:subsequence with starting position -INF

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-005
test-case.description: Test unbounded fn:subsequence with starting position NaN

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-006
test-case.description: Test subsequence optimizations.
test-case.test: subsequence((1, 2, for $x in 1 to 10 return 2*$x), 2, year-from-date(current-date()))

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-007
test-case.description: Test subsequence optimizations.
test-case.test: subsequence((1, 2, for $x in 1 to 10 return 2*$x), -1, sum((1 to 10)[. mod 10 = 3]))

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-008
test-case.description: Test subsequence on length out of int range.

modified.change: Added error code. Relating to bug issue #19579

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-009
test-case.description: Test subsequence on starting value out of int range.

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-010
test-case.description: Test subsequence on largest supported (non-infinite) range.

modified.change: allow correct answer or indeterminate error. See bug 20310.
Added error code. Relating to bug issue #19579

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-011
test-case.description: Test unbounded subsequence with starting position out of int range.

modified.change: allow correct answer or indeterminate error. See bug 20310.
Added error code. Relating to bug issue #19579 and #27700

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-012
test-case.description: Test unbounded subsequence with starting position out of int range.

modified.change: allow correct answer or indeterminate error. See bug 20310.
Added error code. Relating to bug issue #19579 and #27700

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-013
test-case.description: Test unbounded subsequence with largest allowed starting position.

modified.change: allow correct answer or indeterminate error. See bug 20310.
Added error code. Relating to bug issue #19579 and #27700

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-014
test-case.description: Test unbounded subsequence with largest allowed starting position.

modified.change: allow correct answer or indeterminate error. See bug 20310.
Added error code. Relating to bug issue #19579 and #27700

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-015
test-case.description: Test subsequence on map expression.

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-016
test-case.description: Test subsequence on something that looks a bit like last but isn't
test-case.test: subsequence( for $x in 1 to 10 return 1 to $x, count(for $x in 0 to 10 return 1 to $x), 1)

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-017
test-case.description: Test subsequence with infinite length starting at first item
test-case.test: subsequence(for $x in 1 to 10 return 1 to $x, 1.2, xs:double("INF"))

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-018
test-case.description: Test subsequence with infinite length starting after first item
test-case.test: subsequence(for $x in 1 to 10 return 1 to $x, 4.2, xs:double("INF"))

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-019
test-case.description: Test subsequence that gets the last item
test-case.test: let $y := for $x in 1 to 10 return $x * $x return subsequence($y, count($y), 3)

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-020
test-case.description: Tests subsequence with static start and length

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-021
test-case.description: Tests an unbounded subsequence with a static start

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-022
test-case.description: Test skip on initial subsequence enumerator

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-023
test-case.description: Test subsequence(for .....)

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-024
test-case.description: Test subsequence(...,1,INF)

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-025
test-case.description: Tries to call GetExpressionProperties on static-subsequence. In fact shows an error in variable binding when expanding path expressions

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-026
test-case.description: Tests for subsequence on divided sequence
test-case.test: let $x := (1 to 10)[. mod 2 = 0] return subsequence((0,$x),3,count($x) div 2)

test-case.name: cbcl-subsequence-027
test-case.description: Tests for subsequence on a map expression
test-case.test: let $z := (1 to 10)[. mod 2 = 0] return subsequence(for $x in $z return floor($x),2,4)
